rev.comment: /* Statements regarding Barack Obama and backlash */ Had Trump previously made the undeserved degree charge? ref?
rev.diff:
Line 243: Line 243:
On April 25, 2011 on [[Anderson Cooper 360]] on [[CNN]], Trump said he wanted Obama to end the issue by releasing a long form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short form Certification of Live Birth, which is Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth).<ref>{{cite web|title= Obama's Birth Certificate |url= http://urbanlegends.about.com/od/barackobama/a/obama_birth_certificate.htm |last=Emery |first=David |work=About.com |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=April 26, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> Trump has received criticism from both the right and the left in the media for his stance.<ref name=Politico33011>{{Cite news|last=Haberman |first=Maggie |title=Bill O'Reilly pounds birther Donald Trump |url=http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0311/52271.html |date=March 30, 2011|work=Polico.com|separator=,|postscript=|accessdate=April 13, 2011}}</ref>On April 27, Trump held a press conference expressing pride at his role in the release of the long-form of Obama's birth certificate.
On April 25, 2011 on [[Anderson Cooper 360]] on [[CNN]], Trump said he wanted Obama to end the issue by releasing a long form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short form Certification of Live Birth, which is Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth).<ref>{{cite web|title= Obama's Birth Certificate |url= http://urbanlegends.about.com/od/barackobama/a/obama_birth_certificate.htm |last=Emery |first=David |work=About.com |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=April 26, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> Trump has received criticism from both the right and the left in the media for his stance.<ref name=Politico33011>{{Cite news|last=Haberman |first=Maggie |title=Bill O'Reilly pounds birther Donald Trump |url=http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0311/52271.html |date=March 30, 2011|work=Polico.com|separator=,|postscript=|accessdate=April 13, 2011}}</ref>On April 27, Trump held a press conference expressing pride at his role in the release of the long-form of Obama's birth certificate.
â
In the April 27 press conference, after the birth certificate was released by Obama, Trump reiterated a question raised previously whether Obama's college grades were sufficient for Harvard admission and called for the release of Obama's transcripts from Occidental College.<ref>[http://nation.foxnews.com/donald-trump/2011/04/08/msnbc-host-wants-parent-company-fire-trump MSNBC Host Wants Parent Company to Fire Trump] [http://washingtonscene.thehill.com/in-the-know/36-news/9131-weiner-nbc-should-tell-trump-youre-fired Weiner: NBC Should Tell Trump "You're Fired"]</ref><ref name=Schieffer>{{cite news|author=Schieffer, Bob|title=Schieffer: Racism underlying Trump's assertions|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20058072-503544.html|date=April 27, 2011|work=CBS News|publisher=CBS Interactive|accessdate=April 27, 2011}}</ref> Trump's statements were criticized by journalists, commentators and comedians.<ref name=Cina>{{cite news|author=Cina, Mark|title=Who Hates Donald Trump Most in Hollywood Now|date=April 29, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/who-hates-donald-trump-hollywood-183731|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Miller, Daniel|title=Donald Trump's 'Celebrity Apprentice': Why Only One Advertiser Has Fired Him (Analysis)|date=May 3, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/donald-trumps-celebrity-apprentice-why-184320|publisher=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref name=Schieffer/><ref>[http://www.cnn.com/2011/OPINION/05/05/thomas.trump.obama/index.html?hpt=T2 "Trump's disrespect for President Obama"], May 6 2011 via CNN.com</ref> Many people, upon hearing Trump's Apr 27 remarks, made inflammatory remarks that have been ommitted from this text as being unrepeatable at this time on Wikipedia.
+
In the April 27 press conference, after the birth certificate was released by Obama, Trump questioned whether Obama's college grades were sufficient for Harvard admission and called for the release of Obama's transcripts from Occidental College.<ref>[http://nation.foxnews.com/donald-trump/2011/04/08/msnbc-host-wants-parent-company-fire-trump MSNBC Host Wants Parent Company to Fire Trump] [http://washingtonscene.thehill.com/in-the-know/36-news/9131-weiner-nbc-should-tell-trump-youre-fired Weiner: NBC Should Tell Trump "You're Fired"]</ref><ref name=Schieffer>{{cite news|author=Schieffer, Bob|title=Schieffer: Racism underlying Trump's assertions|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20058072-503544.html|date=April 27, 2011|work=CBS News|publisher=CBS Interactive|accessdate=April 27, 2011}}</ref> Trump's statements were criticized by journalists, commentators and comedians.<ref name=Cina>{{cite news|author=Cina, Mark|title=Who Hates Donald Trump Most in Hollywood Now|date=April 29, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/who-hates-donald-trump-hollywood-183731|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Miller, Daniel|title=Donald Trump's 'Celebrity Apprentice': Why Only One Advertiser Has Fired Him (Analysis)|date=May 3, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/donald-trumps-celebrity-apprentice-why-184320|publisher=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref name=Schieffer/><ref>[http://www.cnn.com/2011/OPINION/05/05/thomas.trump.obama/index.html?hpt=T2 "Trump's disrespect for President Obama"], May 6 2011 via CNN.com</ref> Many people, upon hearing Trump's Apr 27 remarks, made inflammatory remarks that have been ommitted from this text as being unrepeatable at this time on Wikipedia.
On April 6, it was announced that Trump had been replaced as the scheduled driver of the pace car of the upcoming Indy 500. A Trump spokesman attributed the change to a 'scheduling conflict', while other sources attributed the change to the anti-trump protests directed towards Indy and its sponsors.
On April 6, it was announced that Trump had been replaced as the scheduled driver of the pace car of the upcoming Indy 500. A Trump spokesman attributed the change to a 'scheduling conflict', while other sources attributed the change to the anti-trump protests directed towards Indy and its sponsors.
